fields.description:
*Assessment*

Cloud administrators (e.g. users under the eucalyptus account) don't have control over ELB, AS, and Cloudwatch resources of non-eucalyptus account users, but can control EC2, IAM resources.  This will cause a nightmare for cloud administrators to handle resources for non-eucalyptus account users that want to enforce some type of SLA (the current [IAM quotas|http://www-stage.eucalyptus-systems.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.4/index.html#ag/access_policy_quota.html] to granular enough). 

*Signs*

Cloud administrators can describe ELB, Cloudwatch, AutoScaling resources, but can't terminate/delete/suspend resources.  Example below:

_resource of account1/user03_
{code}
# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups --region account1-user03@
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	MyScalingGroup	MyLaunchConfig	Legend		1	1	1	Default
INSTANCE	i-4B514374	Legend	InService	Healthy	MyLaunchConfig

#### Described by eucalyptus/admin user
# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups  verbose --region eucalyptus-admin@
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	MyScalingGroup	MyLaunchConfig	Legend		1	1	1	Default
INSTANCE	i-4B514374	Legend	InService	Healthy	MyLaunchConfig

#### Describe resource of eucalyptus/admin user
# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups --region eucalyptus-admin@
#
{code}

_attempt to control autoscaling group of account1/user03_
{code}
### attempt to suspend autoscaling group by eucalyptus/admin user
# euscale-suspend-processes MyScalingGroup --region eucalyptus-admin@
euscale-suspend-processes: error (ValidationError): Auto scaling group not found: MyScalingGroup

### account1/user03 controlling the resource
# euscale-suspend-processes MyScalingGroup --region account1-user03@
# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups --region account1-user03@
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	MyScalingGroup	MyLaunchConfig	Legend		1	1	1	Default
INSTANCE	i-4B514374	Legend	InService	Healthy	MyLaunchConfig
SUSPENDED-PROCESS	Terminate	Manual suspension	MyScalingGroup
SUSPENDED-PROCESS	AddToLoadBalancer	Manual suspension	MyScalingGroup
SUSPENDED-PROCESS	HealthCheck	Manual suspension	MyScalingGroup
SUSPENDED-PROCESS	ScheduledActions	Manual suspension	MyScalingGroup
SUSPENDED-PROCESS	ReplaceUnhealthy	Manual suspension	MyScalingGroup
SUSPENDED-PROCESS	Launch	Manual suspension	MyScalingGroup
SUSPENDED-PROCESS	AlarmNotification	Manual suspension	MyScalingGroup
SUSPENDED-PROCESS	AZRebalance	Manual suspension	MyScalingGroup

### attempt by eucalyptus/admin user to resume resource
# euscale-resume-processes MyScalingGroup --region eucalyptus-admin@
euscale-resume-processes: error (ValidationError): Auto scaling group not found: MyScalingGroup

### resource control by account1/user03 user
# euscale-resume-processes MyScalingGroup --region account1-user03@
# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups --region account1-user03@
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	MyScalingGroup	MyLaunchConfig	Legend		1	1	1	Default
INSTANCE	i-4B514374	Legend	InService	Healthy	MyLaunchConfig
{code}

*Steps*

* Stand up Eucalyptus 3.4 cloud
* Create a non-eucalyptus account, and user under that account
* Upload policy for that user that allows control of AutoScaling, Cloudwatch, Elastic Load Balancing
{code}
{
  "Statement": [
    {
      "Sid": "Stmt1381761814300",
      "Action": "ec2:*",
      "Effect": "Allow",
      "Resource": "*"
    },
    {
      "Sid": "Stmt1381761831949",
      "Action": "autoscaling:*",
      "Effect": "Allow",
      "Resource": "*"
    },
    {
      "Sid": "Stmt1381544067485",
      "Action": "cloudwatch:*",
      "Effect": "Allow",
      "Resource": "*"
    },
    {
      "Sid": "Stmt1381544143893",
      "Action": "elasticloadbalancing:*",
      "Effect": "Allow",
      "Resource": "*"
    }
  ]
}
{code}
* Create Autoscaling, Cloudwatch, ELB resources using non-eucalyptus account user
* Attempt to manage those resources using the eucalyptus/admin user

*Pertinent Data*

Its understood that Privileged Personas may handle this in 4.0, but it would be really great if we could do something for 3.4.1. 

*Workaround*

A potential workaround is writing an advanced script that uses euca-get-credentials for each user, then control the AS, CLW, ELB resource accordingly.  euare-useraddkey could be used, but then you would have to delete the key after the auditing is done.  euca-get-credentials doesn't count towards the credentials math that Euare uses.
fields.summary: Cloud Administrator Can't Control ELB, AS, Cloudwatch Resources of non-eucalyptus account Users

comments.body: sosreport from CLC/Walrus machine attached.  Logging was set to use EXTREME.

Some information on administration for auto scaling is in the design document:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/architecture/wiki/autoscaling-3.3-design#wiki-Administrative_Functionality

Hey [~sjones],

Thanks for the information regarding AutoScaling.  Whats the proper use of passing the ARN to delete the autoscaling resources.  I tried the following:

{code}
# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups --show-long verbose --region eucalyptus-admin@
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	MyScalingGroup	MyLaunchConfig	Legend	2013-10-22T19:52:18.989Z		EC2	1	1	1	300	0			arn:aws:autoscaling::735723906303:autoScalingGroup:45de5d1a-501e-49e3-acce-eaa8002c654f:autoScalingGroupName/MyScalingGroup	Default
INSTANCE	i-4B514374	Legend	InService	Healthy	MyLaunchConfig
# euscale-delete-auto-scaling-group arn:aws:autoscaling::735723906303:autoScalingGroup:45de5d1a-501e-49e3-acce-eaa8002c654f:autoScalingGroupName/MyScalingGroup --region eucalyptus-admin@
# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups --show-long verbose --region eucalyptus-admin@AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	MyScalingGroup	MyLaunchConfig	Legend	2013-10-22T19:52:18.989Z		EC2	1	1	1	300	0			arn:aws:autoscaling::735723906303:autoScalingGroup:45de5d1a-501e-49e3-acce-eaa8002c654f:autoScalingGroupName/MyScalingGroup	Default
INSTANCE	i-4B514374	Legend	InService	Healthy	MyLaunchConfig

# euscale-delete-auto-scaling-group --region eucalyptus-admin@ arn:aws:autoscaling::735723906303:autoScalingGroup:45de5d1a-501e-49e3-acce-eaa8002c654f:autoScalingGroupName/MyScalingGroup
# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups --show-long verbose --region eucalyptus-admin@
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	MyScalingGroup	MyLaunchConfig	Legend	2013-10-22T19:52:18.989Z		EC2	1	1	1	300	0			arn:aws:autoscaling::735723906303:autoScalingGroup:45de5d1a-501e-49e3-acce-eaa8002c654f:autoScalingGroupName/MyScalingGroup	Default
INSTANCE	i-4B514374	Legend	InService	Healthy	MyLaunchConfig
{code}

I looked at the various options that can be passed to euscale-delete-auto-scaling-group, but didn't see anything in particular that I was doing wrong.

{code}
# euscale-delete-auto-scaling-group --help
usage: euscale-delete-auto-scaling-group [-d] [--region USER@REGION | -U URL]
                                         [-I KEY_ID] [-S KEY] [--debug]
                                         [--debugger] [--version] [-h]
                                         ASGROUP

Delete an auto-scaling group

positional arguments:
  ASGROUP               name of the auto-scaling group to delete (required)

optional arguments:
  -d, --force-delete    delete the group and all of its instances without
                        waiting for all instances to terminate
  --region USER@REGION  name of the region and/or user in config files to use
                        to connect to the service
  -U URL, --url URL     auto-scaling service endpoint URL
  -I KEY_ID, --access-key-id KEY_ID
  -S KEY, --secret-key KEY
  --debug               show debugging output
  --debugger            launch interactive debugger on error
  --version             show the program's version and exit
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
{code}

Additionally, regarding Cloudwatch and ELB, are there similar hooks for cloud administrators.  I reviewed the following pages, but didn't see anything that struck me as helpful.

* https://github.com/eucalyptus/architecture/wiki/elb-3.3-elb-design#wiki-Admin_Interfaces
* https://github.com/eucalyptus/architecture/wiki/cloudwatch-3.3-spec
* https://github.com/eucalyptus/architecture/wiki/elb-3.4-spec

Thanks for your help with this.  Let me know if you have any questions.
[~hspencer], it should be the case that you can pass the ARN instead of the group name, but unfortunately this is not working (and presumably never worked correctly)

[~sjones],

Thanks for the info.  As of now, the only workaround that I see is what I mentioned in the Description.  Hopefully, we can get something in 3.4.1.  If not, I am thinking it will probably be resolved in 4.0 via Personas.
[~hspencer] For ELB, eucalyptus account can describe and delete non-eucalyptus account's LBs.

Hey [~spark],

Question, I know that using the verbose option, the user of the eucalyptus account can see all the ELBs on the cloud.  How would they delete the ELBs of non-eucalyptus accounts?  Do you still pass the verbose option?  Thanks for your help with this.
[~hspencer] You can use LB's name if there's only one name across all accounts. If more than one name is found, you can use DNS name of the LB with delete.

Hey [~spark], 

Thanks for the information.  I tested it out below and it worked:

{code}
# eulb-create-lb -z LayinDaSmackDown -l "lb-port=80, protocol=HTTP, instance-port=80, instance-protocol=HTTP" MyLoadBalancer --region account1-user01@
DNS_NAME	MyLoadBalancer-961915002812.lb.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
# eulb-describe-lbs --region account1-user01@
LOAD_BALANCER	MyLoadBalancer	MyLoadBalancer-961915002812.lb.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	2013-10-30T03:02:53.39Z
# eulb-describe-lbs verbose --region eucalyptus-admin@
LOAD_BALANCER	MyLoadBalancer	MyLoadBalancer-961915002812.lb.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	2013-10-30T03:02:53.39Z
# eulb-delete-lb MyLoadBalancer-961915002812.lb.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com --region eucalyptus-admin@
# eulb-describe-lbs verbose --region eucalyptus-admin@
#
# eulb-describe-lbs --region account1-user01@
#
{code}

I looked in the [Eucalyptus Administration Guide for 3.4.0|http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.4/index.html#shared/manage_section.html] but didn't see any reference to this information.  Is this located somewhere in the docs?  I want to make sure I don't add this to the DOC ticket I want to raise from this issue if its already documented.  Again, thanks for your help here.
[~hspencer], given earlier comments for ELB and the fixes for autoscaling (EUCA-8076) and cloudwatch (EUCA-8074) in 3.4.1 what remaining issues need to be addressed for this issue to be closed?

[~sjones],

If all those issues are resolved in 3.4.1, its good to be closed.  Thanks for resolving this.
Do we need a linked DOC ticket here?
This appears to be resolved by EUCA-8076 (EUCA-8074 can we close this issue?
[~mmunn1],  if there is a DOC ticket that is open to explain how these resources can be controlled by the cloud admin, I think this issue can be closed for 3.4.1.  Thoughts?
[~hspencer] I do not see where a doc ticket was opened and linked for this issue, please open one.
Created DOC-1125 to document how cloud administrators can manage these resources.
Ok I am going to close this issue as resolved.
